intro: Dinteranthus pole-evansii, commonly known as the Evans' dinteranthus, is a rare and endemic flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
